name: readlink
shortDescription: print resolved symbolic links or canonical file names
longDescription: Note realpath(1) is the preferred command to use for canonicalization functionality.

options.name: canonicalize
options.description: Activate canonicalize mode.  If any component of the file name except the last one is missing or unavailable, ‘readlink’ produces no output and exits with a nonzero exit code.  A trailing slash is ignored.

options.name: canonicalize-existing
options.description: Activate canonicalize mode.  If any component is missing or unavailable, ‘readlink’ produces no output and exits with a nonzero exit code.  A trailing slash requires that the name resolve to a directory.

options.name: canonicalize-missing
options.description: Activate canonicalize mode.  If any component is missing or unavailable, ‘readlink’ treats it as a directory.

options.name: no-newline
options.description: Do not print the output delimiter, when a single FILE is specified. Print a warning if specified along with multiple FILEs.

options.name: quiet
options.description: Suppress most error messages.  On by default.

options.name: silent
options.description: Suppress most error messages.  On by default.

options.name: zero
options.description: Output a zero byte (ASCII NUL) at the end of each line, rather than a newline.  This option enables other programs to parse the output even when that output would contain data with embedded newlines.
